results.title: Medical Controlled Substances Transportation Act of 2017
results.short_title: Medical Controlled Substances Transportation Act of 2017
results.latest_major_action: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
results.summary: Medical Controlled Substances Transportation Act of 2017 This bill amends the Controlled Substances Act to direct the Drug Enforcement Administration to register practitioners (other than pharmacies) to transport controlled substances to and administer controlled substances in other states, subject to specified conditions.
results.summary_short: Medical Controlled Substances Transportation Act of 2017 This bill amends the Controlled Substances Act to direct the Drug Enforcement Administration to register practitioners (other than pharmacies) to transport controlled substances to and administer controlled substances in other states, subject to specified conditions.

actions.description: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 416 - 2 (Roll no. 349). (text: CR 07/11/2017 H5396)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H5485)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 416 - 2 (Roll no. 349).
Considered as unfinished business.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1492.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H5396-5398; text of measure as introduced: CR H5396)
Mr. Burgess moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H5396-5398)
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 131.
Committee on the Judiciary discharged.
Reported by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 115-192, Part I.
Subcommittee on Health Discharged.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to House Judiciary
Referred to House Energy and Commerce

votes.question: On Motion to Suspend the Rules and Pass
